medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 6 AM this morning with infraumbilical abdominal pain and non-bilious non-bloody emesis followed by a normal bowel movement. The patient reported drinking about one pint of vodka prior to symptom onset. The severity of abdominal pain prompted the patient to request transport to the ED.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1) Hepatitis C, genotype 1, c/b cirrhosis s/p ribavirin and peg-interferon x 48 weeks without response; 2) Hypertension; 3) Psoriasis; 4) History of diverticulitis with colovesicular fistula requiring resection; 5) History of nephrolithiasis.
